entries.text: {'domain': 'Existential Reflections', 'claim': 'Life inherently involves disappointment, which is unavoidable and unchangeable.', 'generalized': 'Disappointment is a fundamental aspect of the human condition, universally experienced.'}

source.book: Cioran, E. M. - Trouble With Being Born (Seaver, 2011)

entries.text: {'domain': 'Mental Well-being', 'claim': 'Imaginary or self-inflicted emotional pain is often perceived as more real than external suffering.', 'generalized': 'Internal, persistent emotional distress can feel as profound or even more real than objective external pain.'}

source.book: Cioran, E. M. - Trouble With Being Born (Seaver, 2011)

entries.text: {'domain': 'Creative Process', 'claim': "The state of 'exhaustion' in art paradoxically makes it both difficult and easier to produce.", 'generalized': 'When a field is depleted or fatigued, its creation becomes simultaneously harder to innovate and easier to replicate.'}

source.book: Cioran, E. M. - Trouble With Being Born (Seaver, 2011)

entries.text: {'domain': 'Existential Reflections', 'claim': "Meaning is derived from navigating and confronting the 'terrible' core of existence.", 'generalized': 'Deep understanding or purpose arises from grappling with fundamental existential challenges.'}

source.book: Cioran, E. M. - Trouble With Being Born (Seaver, 2011)

aggregated_from.book: Cioran, E. M. - Trouble With Being Born (Seaver, 2011)
